text: Tap. Pours light gold. Aroma and flavor are pale and cereal malts, soft citrus, and faint grassiness. Light body.

On tap at Victory in Downingtown. It pours a clear light golden color with a white head. The aroma is bready with a little lemongrass hoppiness. The flavor is bready with more strong lemongrass hops. Good pale malt character as well. A hoppy Kolsch made with German hops (apparantly). I like it.
Bottle. Grainy barley malt and straw aroma. Golden yellow with large head. Grainy corn/barley malt and mildly bitter herbal hay flavor. Okay.

Bottle:
Slightly hazed yellow with a tall white head.
Sweet grain, light fruit aroma.
Light, sweet, grain malt, lemony flavour....
A slightly spicy grassy hop at the finish.
Very nice....light, but malty.
Refreshing.

355ml bottle. Pretty clear pale golden color, large frothy/foamy head. Aroma is very basic making quite true to style, bread notes, light hearbs, hay must, and vague tartness. Flavor is a bit soapier, maltier, dryer, and hoppier than the typical koelsch, in fact quite bitter. Decent brew aimed at US palates.
Bottle. Pours a pale yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty grainy weak hoppy aroma. Fruity malty grainy weak grassy hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty grainy grassy finish.
Clear yellow-orange pour. Sweet and buttery aroma, wheat, malt, hop, yeast, corn, pilsner like. Notes of malt, alcohol, some citrus, and hop prevails in the end.

[ Bottle ][ 12oz ][ ryan ][ Free ][ Conical Pint ][ 8.13.15 ]
>> Great foam atop a sparking gold pour. Neutral nose. Salty, funky, sweaty flavor, big sourdough, mildly tart, fresh bread, corn. Neutral bitterness. Great sour backend, quenching, perfect malt base. Raw and delicious.

Aroma is light malty and sweet. Theres a dry undertone of grass. Taste is grainy and light bready with a soft hop style. Biscuity and crisp. Clean and light. Top notch!! I liked it, even if its kind of discrete.

Kölsch is one of those niche styles Ive been trying to appreciate in recent years, but havent really found any that have amazed me. Most tend to taste fine and drink pretty easy, much like Victory Kühl Kölsch. 

I poured a 12oz bottle into a pilsner glass. It had an enjoy by date of 9/9/15.

Appearance: Pure golden color with near crystal clarity. Slow, fine carbonation can be seen drifting up. Pours to a fairly large, white, frothy head which retains and laces pretty well.

Smell: Light pale malt scent plus mineral water. Perhaps a hint of fruit. Otherwise mild.

Taste: Ive really come to appreciate the pilsner style, so itd seem like Kölsch would be right up my alley since theyre quite similar. This beer has a pretty simple recipe of only pilsner and wheat and two Noble hops and the palette certainly conveys this. Light lager-like taste up front with only the faintest bready character. Through the middle I detect a light spicy sensation from the hops, but it is not particularly bitter. The finish is a bit odd with a bit of a biscuit flavor and what seems like very hard water due to a high mineral content. Not much going on here aside from this, but I can dig it.

Drinkability: At only 4.9% ABV, Victory Kühl Kölsch is a relatively light beer and drinks as such. The mouthfeel is crisp and thin with a very smooth finish. There is some lingering aftertaste of wheat, though. Refreshing while in the mouth, but not especially lively while in it. A fine summertime beer.

Score: 7/10
Yellow, clear. Smells grainy, corny. Taste is pretty much the same, with some grassy hops in the finish. Not really much distinctive about this.
Golden yellow with a white head. Grainy malt aroma. Balanced hops come in with noble hop flavors. Good for the summer.

Faint yellow color with with white head. Light aroma of bready malts and grassy hops. Taste is light, crisp, cracker and grassy floral hops. Slight sweet but balanced finish. Refreshing, clean drinkable. Good summer beer.
Didnt get much of an aroma from this other than some grassy hops and faint tardiness. Very crisp palate. Dry and hoppy.

Pours golden light orange-yellow with a thin white head with decent lacing. Aroma is of bready malts, pils malts, floral hops, light grassy hops, light pine, and some light spicy hops. Taste is about the same as the aroma with the addition of some light citrus fruitiness and cracker sweet malts. Has a medium-light body with a semi creamy mouthfeel and a semi dry, slightly bitter, medium finish. Overall, a excellent kolsch that is super refreshing and drinkable.

From a 12 oz onto a glass. Pours a very light straw color with a wee bit o frothy white head. Tangy aroma. Mouthfeel is light and slightly biting. Taste is grassy hops lemon and some other stuff that's kind of earthy. Lots of flavor and easy to drink. Slightly dirty tasting but that's very minor. Damn good beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle or two shared with Posey at the creek. Pours clear yellow with one finger of white head. Flavor is slightly sweet and slightly floral. Nice refreshing beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Solid and refreshing Kolsch. Free sample! Golden colored. Had a slight pale malt sweetness, some fruitiness, and a nice balance to the breadiness. Super light and perfect for summer. Great light option.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2015 Bottle from summer variety pack into pint glass, clear pale golden color with white head. Aroma notes of light pale malt sweetness and faint fruitiness. Taste adds some light grainy toastiness and faint grass. Light body, moderate-low carbonation, crisp with clean finish. Finding myself enjoying the light simplicity of kolschs, this is no exception.
Good representation of the style, but not many appreciate the style in the US.

Light malt aroma, with just a hint of fruit. Pours a pale clear light straw with a thin white head and very visible carbonation. Mild malt flavor, with just a touch of fruit notes to it. Clean crisp flavor, and very light bodied. Theres a hint of hop bitterness that peeks out in the finish, and quickly fades. This is a really nice light summer beer.

Bottle. Yellow gold with a thick head. The aroma has a tart yeast element and the taste adds some sweet malts with a bite on the finish. I love this one. Perfect for summer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours gold with a small white head. Aroma is citrus, grass, earthy and toast. Taste is lightly tart with some sweet undertones. Light bodied and exceptionally easy to drink. Very enjoyable summer beer with a clean and crisp finish.
Smooth and crisp. Has a bite at the beginning that flattens out quickly. Leaves mouth feeling clean/crisp
Clear pale yellow pour, decent white head. Nose is Pils malt and hay. Bittersweet. Middle is Sweet malt, bread, and faint hard fruit. Finish is crisp and clean. Quite refreshing.

Pours a clean and sharp straw gold blonde with two fingers of tight white head. Nose is grassy with a lightly sweet malty note. Lightly toasted grain in the flavor with some bready and biscuity notes. A grassy bitterness and light body round it out.

Clear golden body, medium to thin white head, spotty lacing. Light grass, lemon and orange zest, toasted white bread, and light cracker. Medium to light bodied with moderate carbonation, light sweetness throughout, lingering finish.

12 oz bottle. Pours clear gold with a fluffy white head that lasts. Aroma has faint lemon Apple grain corn. Taste has a mild hop bitterness and faint tart lemon and a corn grain finish. Palate is light and crisp.
On tap at brewpub. Pours gold with white head. Grass bright citrus typical Victory base. Light bitterness moderately sweet smooth medium body

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2016 Golden color with a medium sized, white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of toast, grass, light citrus. Taste of the same, toasty malts, sweeter finish, low bitterness.
